thread.title: Yatani to ditch ODM party for Jubilee in re-election bid
thread.title_full: Yatani to ditch ODM party for Jubilee in re-election bid

title: Yatani to ditch ODM party for Jubilee in re-election bid
text:
Yatani to ditch ODM party for Jubilee in re-election bid Wednesday February 22 2017 Marsabit Governor Ukur Yatani, who is set to join the Jubilee Party after ditching ODM in preparations for the August 8 elections. PHOTO | PHOEBE OKALL | NATION MEDIA GROUP In Summary He condemned “political tourists”, from other counties who have been pitching camp in Marsabit to politick. Yatani termed as propaganda claims that he wants to use the back door to clinch the Jubilee ticket. He added that it is not a secret any more that he wants to join Jubilee. 
Marsabit Governor Ukur Yatani is set to join the Jubilee Party after ditching the Orange Democratic Movement (ODM). 
“Plans are under way to join JP so that we can seek our re-election,” Mr Yatani said Tuesday. 
The governor also condemned what he termed “political tourism”, saying leaders from other counties have been pitching camp in Marsabit to politick. 
“Those coming from Tana River and Isiolo counties to tell our people how our leadership should be are outsiders. They do not know how we operate in our county,” he said. 
The county boss challenged his opponents to tell the people what they will do if elected. 
“Instead of trying to convince people that the county government has done no development, tell them what you want to do,” said Mr Yatani. 
He said the leaders who are spreading propaganda that he wants to use the back door to clinch the Jubilee ticket should know that he will join the party through the open route. 
NOT A SECRET ANYMORE 
He added that it is not a secret any more that he wants to join Jubilee. 
“There is no need in giving warnings and threats to the president over ticket issues. We soon will know the decision of the people because they have the voice,” said Mr Yatani 
On Saturday, gubernatorial aspirant and NHIF boss Mohamud Ali said that the governor has been attending meetings with the president and his deputy trying to join Jubilee as the general elections approach. 
He said that he and his team are Jubilee members and founders of the party in Marsabit and are therefore not afraid of intruders. 
“If they want to join Jubilee let them come through the right path instead of trying to use the backdoor. We will gladly welcome them and meet them in the nominations. We are not afraid because we believe the people have the voice,” said Mr Mohamud.
